Dear Ms. Puga:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 10, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the
contract and ISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MSA
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not obtained and
maintained compliance for rules found in repeated noncompliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4108 Financing and audit.
A licensee shall do all of the following: (a) Obtain an annual
audit of all financial accounts. Audits for nongovernmental
institutions shall be conducted by an independent certified
public accountant who is not administratively related to the
agency.
The agency submitted a budget statement but did not submit an independent annual
financial audit. The administrator reported the audit is pending for the last three
annual periods. Repeat Violation: Renewal 2019 with CAP Approved 01/16/2020
and Interim 2020 with Cap Approved 02/09/2021.
Rule 400.4116 Chief administrator; responsibilities.
(b) Develop and implement a written plan to correct, within
6 months, rule violations identified as a result of the
assessment conducted pursuant to subdivision (a) of this
subrule.
Chief Administrator did not comply with corrective action plan submitted on
02/09/2021 in reference to repeated violation for Rule 108 (submitting an annual
audit of all financial account by a certified public accountant).
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility does not care for plaintiff class youth.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1.
This is not a contracted facility; therefore, DHHS policy and contract requires do not
apply.
4

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or child abuse and/or
neglect during this licensing period.
The facility has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period as follows.
The first one was for a special investigation involving staff allowing a resident to use
her vape pen. The corrective action plan included the staff person involved was
terminated and training current staff regarding boundaries and complying with
facility’s policy and rules.
The second was for the 2020 Interim Inspection for the following citations:
 Rule 400.4108 Financing and audit
 Rule 400.4113 Employee records
 Rule 400.4128 Initial Staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
 Rule 400.4166 Discharge Plans
 Rule 400.4167 Case Record Maintenance
The agency was not completely successful with the corrective action plan as
indicated by the repeated violation for Rule 400.4108 documented in this report. The
agency hired a new Chief of Administrator that will ensure compliance with the
corrective action plan and rules to eliminate repeated rule violations. The corrective
action plan for this citation will have to include, in part, submission of a completed
financial audit.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
